classes module

class classes.Course(course_id, course_name, instructor, enrolled_students=None)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a course in the school management system.

Courses can have an assigned instructor and maintain a list of enrolled students. Provides functionality for managing course enrollment and instructor assignments.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – Unique identifier for the course

  • course_name (str) – Name or title of the course

  • instructor (Instructor or None) – Instructor assigned to teach the course

  • enrolled_students (list, optional) – List of students enrolled in the course, defaults to None

Raises:

  • AssertionError – If course_id is not a non-empty string

  • AssertionError – If course_name is not a non-empty string

  • AssertionError – If instructor is provided but not an Instructor object

add_student(student)[source]

Adds a student to the course enrollment list.

Enrolls the student in this course by adding them to the list of enrolled students. The student must be a valid Student object.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to enroll in the course

Raises:

AssertionError – If student is not a valid Student object

from_dict(data)[source]

Updates course object attributes from dictionary data.

Restores basic course information from dictionary. Student and instructor relationships must be rebuilt separately.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Dictionary containing course information

to_dict()[source]

Converts course object to dictionary format for serialization.

Creates a dictionary representation of the course with basic information for persistence purposes. Student and instructor relationships are handled separately.

Returns:

Dictionary containing course ID and name

Return type:

dict

class classes.Instructor(name, age, email, instructor_id, assigned_courses=None)[source]

Bases: Person

Represents an instructor in the school management system.

Instructors can be assigned to teach multiple courses and maintain a list of their assigned courses. Inherits basic person attributes from Person class.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Full name of the instructor

  • age (int) – Age of the instructor in years

  • email (str) – Email address of the instructor

  • instructor_id (str) – Unique identifier for the instructor

  • assigned_courses (list, optional) – List of courses assigned to the instructor, defaults to None

Raises:

AssertionError – If instructor_id is not a non-empty string

assign_course(course)[source]

Assigns a course to the instructor.

Adds the course to the instructor’s list of assigned courses. The course must be a valid Course object.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to assign to the instructor

Raises:

AssertionError – If course is not a valid Course object

from_dict(data, courseDict=None)[source]

Updates instructor object attributes from dictionary data with course reconstruction.

Restores instructor information from dictionary and rebuilds course relationships using the provided course dictionary lookup.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing instructor information

  • courseDict (dict, optional) – Dictionary mapping course IDs to Course objects, defaults to None

to_dict()[source]

Converts instructor object to dictionary format for serialization.

Creates a dictionary representation of the instructor including all assigned course IDs for persistence purposes.

Returns:

Dictionary containing instructor information and assigned course IDs

Return type:

dict

class classes.Person(name, age, email)[source]

Bases: object

Base class representing a person in the school management system.

This class provides common attributes and functionality for all people in the system including students and instructors. It handles basic validation for name, age, and email format.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Full name of the person

  • age (int) – Age of the person in years

  • email (str) – Email address of the person

Raises:

  • AssertionError – If name is not a string or is empty

  • AssertionError – If age is not an integer or is negative

  • AssertionError – If email is not a string or has invalid format

from_dict(data)[source]

Updates person object attributes from dictionary data.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Dictionary containing person information

to_dict()[source]

Converts person object to dictionary format for serialization.

Returns:

Dictionary containing person’s basic information

Return type:

dict

class classes.Student(name, age, email, student_id, registered_courses=None)[source]

Bases: Person

Represents a student in the school management system.

Students can register for courses and maintain a list of their enrolled courses. Inherits basic person attributes from Person class.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Full name of the student

  • age (int) – Age of the student in years

  • email (str) – Email address of the student

  • student_id (str) – Unique identifier for the student

  • registered_courses (list, optional) – List of courses the student is registered for, defaults to None

Raises:

AssertionError – If student_id is not a non-empty string

from_dict(data, courseDict=None)[source]

Updates student object attributes from dictionary data with course reconstruction.

Restores student information from dictionary and rebuilds course relationships using the provided course dictionary lookup.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing student information

  • courseDict (dict, optional) – Dictionary mapping course IDs to Course objects, defaults to None

register_course(course)[source]

Registers the student for a specific course.

Adds the course to the student’s list of registered courses. The course must be a valid Course object.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to register for

Raises:

AssertionError – If course is not a valid Course object

to_dict()[source]

Converts student object to dictionary format for serialization.

Creates a dictionary representation of the student including all registered course IDs for persistence purposes.

Returns:

Dictionary containing student information and registered course IDs

Return type:

dict
